author: Demetria Gallegos
title: How to Financially Protect the Stay-at-Home Spouse
text:
When couples weigh whether one of them should take a career break to care for children, an aging parent or another family member, they usually make a pretty simple calculation: They compare the earning power of each spouse with the cost of hiring a professional caregiver.
But that calculation is too simple. What can seem like a short-term solution to a caregiving need—with one spouse putting their career on temporary hold to assume the caregiving duties—can have damaging long-term consequences.
